Third ventricle.EditorialNote: There is a separate entry for "Entire third ventricle" in UMLS.  This ID is for "third ventricle".
Third ventricle.Definition: Part of the ventricular system of the brain, forming a single large cavity in the midline of the diencephalon;  it is continuous with the lateral ventricles through the interventricular foramen and the fourth ventricle through the cerebral aqueduct. (Maryann Martone.  It is bounded anteriorly by the lamina terminalis;  much of the medial surface is formed by the thalamus and hypothalamus;  part of the hypothalamus forms its floor (Nolte, the Human Brain, 6th ed., 2009, pg 101).
